review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2021
review.title: rough rough surface for a gaming mouse mat, wow
review.review: This mouse mat has a rough surface. There is no way around it. If you play a game like starcraft, or even a shooter where you are making fast movements across the surface, you can get friction burns on your wrists. I've never encountered a mouse mat surface this coarse. The cheap ones at my work have a smoother surface. My wife and I both agreed they were incredibly uncomfortable, even to REST your wrists on for typing, and had to return. I will say the product appeared to be HIGH quality. Very well made and looked like a well built product. I just take issue with that surface for gaming, it is absolutely inappropriate.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2021
review.title: Adds the Right RGB Flare
review.review: If youâ€™re looking for an RGB gaming pad to work with all your other Razer pieces, this is the one.Note: as with almost all other Razer devices, Mac RGB functionality is quite limited (though there is a way to get around this with a slightly-hacked Razer app for Mac that can be found on GitHub). Works like a charm with PC though.Only complaint is that the grey one is pretty prone to spots, and itâ€™s insanely difficult to clean and get spot-free. Even with water, it leaves odd splotches in places. In hindsight, I shouldâ€™ve just went for the black one to avoid this headache altogether.TL;DR: itâ€™s great, just as long as you buy the black one.
product.title: Razer Goliathus Extended Chroma Gaming Mouse Mat - Balanced Control - Black

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
review.title: Good, but came broken.
review.review: I received this item and immediately plugged it in and set it up on my desk.It works, it does the basic function it is designed to do (big pad for your mouse and keyboard).I noticed a brighter light just to the left of the plastic piece that says Razer on the pad (see pictures).So I unplugged it and looked at that section.Well, it is broken/torn.Not sure what the deal is with this, I assumed Razer was higher quality, which is why I bought this item instead of other brands.I am glad I had points I was able to use to make this less expensive since it is obviously cheap.I figure I either received a returned item, this is just poor build quality, or poor handling/packaging that caused this to break (or a combination of all the above).Either way, I would not buy it again, and I do not recommend this to anyone.Quality assurance at this company is apparently not something they are concerned with.Additionally, the stitching that holds the LED tube to the mat is very annoying on my skin.not sure how this passed any sort of user testing.After my recent experience with a few of their other products and this item, I clearly will never buy Razer products again.
product.title: Razer Goliathus Extended Chroma Gaming Mouse Mat - Balanced Control - Black

The Mercury one obviously shows more dirt due to the lighter color. The mats are not the easiest to clean because you have to be gentle to not disturb the fabric too much. You have to clean with the grain of the fabric and use a very mild detergent or just slightly warm water.

I forwarded the case to our warranty team but failed to proceed with warranty claims as after careful inspection and investigation they deemed the damage as normal."I work in IT and folks come to me all the time asking for product recommendations.How can I possibly recommend Razer after this?

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2021
review.title: A very fair mat solution, but wears quickly
review.review: So, I was turned off by all the reports of warping of the EL strips along its sides, but I took the leap and went for it. Happily, in the 9 months of ownership I've had, I can report no warping of the mat: It's as flat as it came on the first day. (...it came rolled up, but.. you know)I like the Extended model for desk coverage. It adds a nice touch to your workspace, and has proven to be easy enough to clean with a damp cloth. The experience has been overall very good.Where it lacks is durability of the cloth skin on the mat. The right hand side (see pic) shows noticeable wear after less than a year of use. This was a disappointment, because if not for that fact I would have given this a no-fault review. A less important nitpick: The single channel EL strip, vs a multi-channel zone strip like what the Firefly uses to produce the wave effect. A mat this large would show off greatly if the EL strip could handle it, IMO.Pictures show a.) the spot on the mat where it's taken notable wear and tear, discoloring and fraying the fabric skin of the mat; and b.) a snapshot of my Goliathus workspace: From left to right: The Razer Charging Pad Chroma, the Blackwidow Chroma v2; the Mouse Dock Chroma; and the Naga Pro. (I like pretty lights.)
product.title: Razer Goliathus Extended Chroma Gaming Mouse Mat - Balanced Control - Black

The texture is dry and super fine on the mouse itself, which makes it hard to grip with dryer hands as well. The side grips are simply un-usable though and I am wishing I had sent this back long ago. I will be getting an MX Master.

review.title: NOT the Naga Hex mouseâ€¦
review.review: As a gaming mouse, this is great!As a replacement for the discontinued Naga Hex mouse that was discontinued in 2019, it takes some getting accustomed to. This is the only reason I give it a 4-star review as opposed to 5.About the mouse:The ergonomic design, while comfortable to hold can strain your pinky if you pick up your mouse often- just a heads up. The different/removable face plates make for great user options and the 7-button face plate makes for a decent replacement of the Naga Hex.
product.title: Razer Naga Pro Wireless Gaming Mouse: Interchangeable Side Plate w/ 2, 6, 12 Button Configurations - Focus+ 20K DPI Optica...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2021
review.title: I hope you have big hands.
review.review: This mouse is definitely *not* for people who have hands on the smaller side of average. I don't have tiny hands by any means, but this mouse is extremely awkward for me to use without accidentally hitting the first row of keys on the side. My hand simply doesn't wrap around enough of the bulk of this thing to get a good grip on only the non-button portions of the mouse. This leads to firing off skills or macros that I absolutely do not intend to use yet while just moving the mouse around; I've had to disable the first row of keys entirely to avoid this.Another problem the size presents is that it won't consistently hold down the LMB if I want to click and drag; it'll often let go prematurely because my fingertips apparently don't reach far enough forward to get the leverage it needs to keep the sensors in contact.Years ago, I had a Naga that had plates you could swap out to adjust the size appropriate to your needs, but they apparently don't make them anymore, and are going with a "one (large) size fits all" approach. This is a major shame, because it's excluding a fairly significant portion of the gaming population.If you have big ol' hands, then I bet this mouse would work great for you. It's lightweight (almost too lightweight) and pretty responsive.
product.title: Razer Naga Pro Wireless Gaming Mouse: Interchangeable Side Plate w/ 2, 6, 12 Button Configurations - Focus+ 20K DPI Optica...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2021
review.title: The only premium wireless mmo mouse. needs some competition
review.review: The only MMO mouse that is wireless, from a name brand company.Features: comes with PTFE mouse feet which is very generous and not common, usually you buy these aftermarket.fairly light considering all the hardware on it. another big plus.comes with 3 side plates. one with 12 buttons, one with 2, and one with I think 6? very cool and convenient, and easy to swap out.no perceivable latency, however I originally bought this mouse used. it would lose connection for several seconds, which is unusable for gaming and just annoying in any other application, especially at this price.I returned it and bought a new one, which has the same issue but only loses connectivity very briefly, enough for me to just ignore. I dont play shooters or 1st person games with it so whatever.the razer software has automatic profile switching. you can set up specific keybinds for any program (even ones that arent games) and when you switch to a different program the keybinds automatically swap. this is insanely useful for video editing, music production, MMOs, all kinds of things.battery life is great. naturally, the lights suck a lot of it up but you should turn them off if you want it to last long.I like the ergonomics a lot, I think it feels great in my hand. it's meant to be held with your fingers laid on it and your palm mostly lifted off of it. it feels very comfortable but I'd like it slightly lighter for easier movement.if it werent for the disconnection this would be 5/5 stars. it has zero ccompetition, is feature packed and is good at what it does.
product.title: Razer Naga Pro Wireless Gaming Mouse: Interchangeable Side Plate w/ 2, 6, 12 Button Configurations - Focus+ 20K DPI Optica...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
review.title: Perfect sound
review.review: I love this headset!!! It is comfortable, easy to adjust, well made, sounds fabulous and was reasonably priced!!! It has a normal headphone jack and comes with a usb adapter to use it on a computer or other device that has usb sound. Works great on ps5 and if you turn the volume for the headset all the way up on the ps5 setting you can manually adjust the volume on the headset quickly and easily with a lage stero style volume knob on the earpiece!
product.title: Razer BlackShark V2 X Gaming Headset: 7.1 Surround Sound - 50mm Drivers - Memory Foam Cushion - PC

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2021
review.title: Mid-Range Quality
review.review: Don't get me wrong, this is a good headset and works great, but it's not incredible. If you're looking for a good headset that'll get the job done and is comfortable, this is a good option. Mic quality is meh, but is so much better than an earbud set mic. I wear glasses with wide frames and it wasn't very comfortable at first, but I got used to it after a couple weeks. Audio playback quality is pretty good and they don't let much outside sound in which is a plus. Good headset, gave it four stars because there are better options for a higher price, but it's still completely worth it.
product.title: Razer BlackShark V2 X Gaming Headset: 7.1 Surround Sound - 50mm Drivers - Memory Foam Cushion - PC

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2021
review.title: Good, but...
review.review: This is a fantastic headset for gaming, or just listening to music. However the range is terrible. If I have to leave the room for anything, I start having issues about 20 feet away. I have other wireless headsets that still function while I'm downstairs getting stuff out of my vehicle in the driveway. I mostly use this for gaming so it's not that big of a deal to me, but for the price, you should get more range than that, especially since it comes with its own plug in transmitter.
product.title: Razer BlackShark V2 X Gaming Headset: 7.1 Surround Sound - 50mm Drivers - Memory Foam Cushion - PC

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2021
review.title: Another bit of e-waste
review.review: Worked very well out of the box for 2-3 months. All of a sudden it stopped working via bluetooth or the dongle. I have tried multiple batteries. Have tried updating drivers both via Windows and Razer's firmware updater. Have installed Razer's ridiculous software which requires you to create an account just to open the software. NOTHING WILL FIX IT. I looked around different boards and it seems many people have had this issue and there is no solution.I feel like I bought a piece of trash that is now useless. Would not recommend buying. I have always had Logitech mice and am going back to them. The close to 20 years i have been using Logitech mice I have not had to fool with them trying to make the combined mice work like i have with this single Razer mouse.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: Lightweight and Comfortable
review.review: I actually use this for working in CAD. I love the ability to adjust sensitivity on the fly, plus the extra programmable buttons. The cable for the wired version is very flexible, and doesn't ever get in the way or move the mouse like the old corded mice I've used. My one complaint is that the side scroll doesn't repeat when you hold it, but this can be worked around with a simple macro. While I use another mouse for gaming, I'd have no problems switching them out.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: I really didnt think i would like this mouse. I couldnt have been more wrong. 10/10.
review.review: Im honestly surprised. Ive had issues with razer in the past, and have been slowly gravitating away from their products. I really like the g502, but the scroll wheel thing is dumb and kind of useless. I use that button for remapping, and its kind of important for my muscle memory.The battery life is great, i havent had it die once and i have rgb on, using it for about a week. RND is great on it, good quality, smooth clicks on both main actuators. It fits really nicely in my hand (mostly claw grip, but i rest my palm on the back, medium hands). The pads on the bottom are literal butter. It glides with 0 friction, even on my admittedly worn mouse mat.Honestly a great mouse.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
review.title: Amazing mouse by far from razer
review.review: I've been a razer member for over 2 years and have been impressed with every product I've gotten, but this one out of them all, was easily the best. It's both cost effective and has amazing lighting features, not to mention a ton of programmable buttons. It's got 2 buttons to both lower and raise the dpi settings, 3 side buttons that are programmable, along with hyperkeys. What that is is the ability to combine 2 or more buttons to make 1 programmable action and u can make a ton of them. I'd personally recommend this mouse to anyone who loves long lasting products, but also amazing RGB. Also will look great in ANY setup. #teamrazer

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2021
review.title: Click away
review.review: Perhaps one of nicest mouse clicking sounds and feeling I have ever heard with hardly any delay between clicks.However a major nitpick I have is when you use the mouse for the first time on a pc it opens up a download prompt for the software which is convenient but distracting when using it on a different pc for the first time (haven't tested it just hypothetically speaking)To use certain features i.e macros you need the software to be installed AND be in the background but overall mouse control you dont need the software.After you figure our your button bindings delete the software then have your pc forget the mouse then reconnect the mouse and close out the download prompt (after you do it once it won't reappear unless you make your pc forget it) This solved the issue I had with it skipping abruptly both in-game and browsing.After these changes its a very solid mouse and felt right at home using it without needing to make any adjustments.Only nitpick I have is that you can't get custom shells individually in the official website or other websites.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2021
review.title: Manufacturing Flaw
review.review: So when I first opened it, it was all sorts of warped. I figured just like any other mousepad either lay books on it to keep it flat or leave it out in the sun so the heat can loosen it up and flatten it. Tried both and neither worked. Googled the issue and came across a YouTube video that explained that it could be the clear tube lining around the edges that is the issue. Basically what I ended up having to do was unscrew the led base and pull out the tube form the lights, I pulled it more snug and tight and fiddled with it for an hour to get it just right. A friend of mine bought one and had no issues so Iâ€™m sure it was just a fluke but my god was it a pain in the ass..itâ€™s still not perfect but itâ€™ll do

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2021
review.title: Do. Not. Buy.
review.review: This controller came with a drift out of the box! This is completely unacceptable from a brand new $154 controller. To add on top of it, there's no return policy, so once you've bought the controller, if it isn't up to standards, that's too bad. Why would I ever purchase this, when the Series 2 Elite Controller feels better, lasts longer than JUST out the box, and is only 20 dollars more for a working controller? Not to mention, I can use it WITHOUT a wire. This is absolutely vile!

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2021
review.title: Had it for a year now, still is a great controller.
review.review: I had this controller for over a year now the and controller is great, gets the job done. It takes a while to get used to, but once you do it's all golden.I do have minor gripes though, I wish you could adjust the deadzones, that they had adjustable tension in the thumb sticks like the Xbox Gaming controller, and is that the tall thumbstick was domed rather than caved, it makes no sense having the smaller thumbstick as the domed one because you're going to be using dome for shooting preferably, which should be the tall one as well.
product.title: Razer Wolverine Ultimate Officially Licensed Xbox One Controller: 6 Remappable Buttons and Triggers - Interchangeable Thum...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2021
review.title: Love it
review.review: I saw an article about this controller and decided to give it a shot for pc gaming. I'm also a playstation guy and not used to the Xbox controller. This thing is amazing. Great weight, crisp mechanical buttons, and it has a grip material on the casing. It just feels amazing in your hands. Well worth the cost imo. Would recommend to everyone.
